question: These cells, whose axons terminate directly on skeletal muscle fibers are also known as 'lower motor neurons.' <image 1>
description: The image appears to be a microscopic view of tissue, likely from a histological section stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E). The tissue shows a mix of different cell types and structures. There are elongated cells with prominent nuclei, which could be indicative of nerve cells or fibroblasts. Additionally, there are areas with a more dense, fibrous appearance, suggesting connective tissue. The overall staining pattern and cellular morphology suggest that this could be a section of neural tissue, possibly including lower motor neurons.
